text:
My web application runs in Tomcat 5.0.30 and uses FORM Authentication 
(configured in web.xml).

Recently, I downloaded JMeter 3.1 and used Http Proxy Server (Non-test 
element) to record a transaction under Thread Group.  When I ran the Thread 
Group, I noticed that all the HTTP Requests were directed back to the login 
page. The http../j_security_check is set with right user name and password and 
returned with the status of 400.

After reading through the forums, I added the Cookie Manager to the Thread 
Group and ran the test. It still failed

While, the same test scenario works fine with JMeter 1.9.1. The Cookie Manager 
handles the JSESSIONID and all HTTP requests returned correct response data.
creator: kamalasekar.r@gmail.com
sebb@apache.org
text:
What happens if you run the test plan created in JMeter 1.9.1 in JMeter 2.3?
Does that work OK?

There must be something else missing from the test plan recorded in 2.3.
Add a Tree View Listener and check the responses carefully.
Also check jmeter.log just in case there are any errors.

You could compare them with the responses you get in 1.9.1.

creator: kamalasekar.r@gmail.com
text:
The test plan created in JMeter 1.9.1 works with JMeter 2.3 and I recorded 
another script under the same test plan with JMeter 2.3, it worked fine.

I probably made the mistake of not adding HTTP Cookie Manager while creating 
the test plan in JMeter 2.3 and when performed the following actions in 
sequence, it worked in JMeter 2.3.

1) Create a Http Proxy Sever (Non-test element), configure inclusion/exclusion 
filters
2) Created a New Thread Group
3) Added Cookie Manager
4) Added Listeners
5) Ran the web application and it created the test plan under Thread Group

Finally, stop the Http Proxy server and run the test plan.

Thanks Sebb.

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
OK, thanks for confirming that the problem has been resolved.

The Cookie Manager only applies when running a test plan. It is not used when 
doing a proxy recording - the browser does its own cookie management.
So it's only necessary to add it after recording the plan.
